Description: Cut from durable yet breathable twill, these men's shorts feature an elasticated waist for comfort and ease. The highlight: contrasting utility pockets bordered with intricate cord work embroidery—a detail that adds motion, depth, and raw identity to a minimal frame. It’s the kind of balance you’d find in Goa—where tradition and function meet on their own terms, and no stitch feels accidental.

Description: Rooted in ease, finished with identity. These shorts are tailored in soft, breathable cotton twill to complement the flow of the matching shirt. Cut for structure without stiffness, they feature a relaxed fit and clean lines—finished with an embroidered Vasavi patch that speaks without shouting. A subtle nod to belonging, made for places where labels aren’t loud, but they still mean something.

Description: Crafted for movement and sharp detail, this asymmetrical mini skirt is made from breathable cotton twill with a clean, structured fit. A concealed side zipper keeps the finish smooth, while tonal cord work zig-zags across the front—bringing bold texture to a minimal shape. Halfway through the design, the piece nods to Goa’s freeform energy—where paths aren’t always straight, but every curve leads somewhere meaningful.

Description: Crafted with precision and purpose, this skirt pairs clean lines with artisanal detail. Made from natural cotton twill, its standout feature is a curved green cord embroidery tracing the front—softly breaking symmetry while inviting movement. At its heart, the piece carries a quiet nod to Goa—not through motifs, but through the energy of handwork and the flow of coastal paths translated into fabric.

Description: This box-pleated shirt is cut from breathable fabric with a structured drape that holds its shape while staying light on the skin. The silhouette is clean, sharp, and architectural—disrupted intentionally by random cord work embroidery that moves across the surface like hand-drawn lines. There’s tension and rhythm in the contrast—like the curated chaos of Goa’s hidden corners, where tradition meets wild instinct.
Fabric Description: COTTON

Description: Crafted with ocean calm and daily ease, this notch collar shirt is stitched from 30s twill—lightweight, soft, and effortless to wear. Embroidered sea creatures add quiet texture, as if they surfaced directly from memory. There’s a hint of Goa in its flow—not in form, but in feeling. A garment that knows how to pause, wander, and return to itself—just like the coast it quietly echoes.
Fabric Description: COTTON & Lycra

Description: Crafted for comfort and elegance, this menswear shirt features premium fabric, coastal-inspired details, and timeless structure—ideal for those who wear their values.

Description: This men’s shirt is crafted from autumn-weight fabric—substantial yet breathable, designed to hold its shape as seasons shift. The silhouette is clean and intentional, but it’s the embroidery on the collar and sleeve that sets it apart—inspired by the graphic lines, signage scripts, and iron latticework found across historic Portuguese railway stations.

Description: This oversized pleated shirt is made from soft cotton, designed to hold volume without weight. The pleats give it form, the lace work breathes life into it—breaking up the fabric with light, line, and subtle contrast. It feels like walking through a sunlit corridor in old Goa—where shadows pass through arches and everything is seen, even in silence.

Description: This oversized shirt is cut from autumn-weight fabric that carries structure without stiffness. The tie-dye base echoes faded azulejo tiles, layered with ornate embroidery pulled from old Goan architecture—floral curves, sacred geometry, hand-meets-memory. It’s the kind of piece that feels like walking through Fountain has at dusk—worn walls, rich colors, and stories stitched into every corner.

Description: This relaxed-fit t-shirt is cut in breathable fabric with a soft, lived-in hand feel. A single macramé patch sits on one shoulder—a tactile interruption that turns simplicity into statement. Each knot is placed with care, blending craftsmanship and calm. It holds the energy of Goa’s backstreets—where craft spills into everyday life, and detail lives without needing attention.

Description: This unisex t-shirt in muted lavender is made for ease—minimal in form, yet meaningful in its finish. On both sleeves, delicate tonal embroidery unfolds like a quiet gesture—inspired by the lattice balconies, tiled corridors, and fading facades of Portuguese-Goan architecture.

Description: Made from plush bamboo terry, this off-white t-shirt brings elevated comfort with a structured fall. The silhouette stays simple, but the detail speaks—block-style embroidery across the collar and front draws from Portuguese tilework traditions, reinterpreting azulejo patterns through thread instead of glaze. Each embroidered block mirrors the order and ornament of old Portuguese facades—repeating forms, floral grids, and sacred symmetry—stitched with the intention of turning textile into architecture. It’s everyday ease woven with old-world memory—like lace etched into stone, or sunlight caught on faded tilework.
Fabric Description: COTTON

Description: Elevate your wardrobe with this stylish twill shirt, featuring a unique knitted-style collar in subtle green shades for a touch of modern sophistication. The all-over twill-printed effect adds texture and depth, making it a standout piece for casual and smart-casual settings alike.

Description: This oversized hoodie is constructed from heavyweight fleece with a soft, structured fall. Along the hood and front pouch, you’ll find ornamental threadwork—inspired by the wrought iron railings of old Goan balconies and colonial staircases. The embroidery isn’t loud—it’s etched like memory—subtle, architectural, and intentionally placed where the body seeks rest: the head, the hands, the hold. This piece frames utility through heritage—where everyday comfort meets the artistry of space once designed to guard, guide, and gaze.
